subject: Re: [junit] Testing XML and XSLT
msgSnippet: ... Hash: SHA1 ... No, because the question was about XML and your solution won t work for several reasons: 1. The indention may be different. 2. The sequence
messageBody:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Am Mittwoch, 2. April 2003 15:30 schrieb Vladimir R. Bossicard:
> > You could create a general
> > assertEquals(String s, File expected, File found);
> > or a more general
> > assertEquals(String s, InputStream expected, InputStream found);
> >
> > Perhaps someone already implemented these?
>
> Do I really have to repeat myself over and over again?
No, because the question was about XML and your solution won't work for
several reasons:
1. The indention may be different.
2. The sequence of the attributes may be different.
3. The result may have attributes that are allowed but not mandatory.
4. The encoding might be different.

A string compare can only be done on exclusively canonized XML.

Bye
